alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 3:48AM CST until March 08 at 11:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River near Conesville. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences along County Road F70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 11.5 feet. - The river is currently at 11.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Saturday evening and rise to a crest of 14.0 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
